text: Serge Ibaka -- the Oklahoma City Thunder forward who was born in the Congo but played in Spain -- has been granted Spanish citizenship and will play for the country in EuroBasket this summer, the event where spots in the 2012 Olympics will be decided.
summaries: Serge Ibaka has been granted Spanish citizenship and will play in EuroBasket.

text: MILAN -Catania held Roma to a 1-1 draw in Serie A on Wednesday as the teams played out the remaining 25 minutes of a game that was called off last month.
summaries: Catania held Roma to a 1 1 draw in Serie A.

text: State Street Corporation, a provider of investment servicing, investment management and investment research and trading services, has launched a new investment servicing solution to support small to mid-sized asset managers with their investment operations needs.
summaries: State Street Corporation, has launched a new investment servicing solution.

text: Massey Energy, the fourth largest coal company in the country, could have its corporate charter revoked if public interest organizations have their way.
summaries: Massey Energy, the coal company, could have its corporate charter revoked.

text: Foundation for MetroWest has awarded $55,000 in grants to 37 food pantries across the region, drawing on two of its funds that provide winter assistance to families in need.
summaries: Foundation for MetroWest has awarded $ 55,000 in grants to 37 food pantries across the region.

text: Wong won't rule out super raid Updated: 08:17, Tuesday March 26, 2013 Finance Minister Penny Wong has declined to rule out axing tax concessions for superannuation in the May budget.
summaries: Wong won't rule out super raid.

text: TINY 'robots' that can be dropped into an industrial process to report any problems are being developed by a Woolston company.
summaries: TINY robots are being developed by a company.

text: Jordan and South Korea have pledged to cooperate on nuclear regulatory issues as part of an agreement signed on Saturday.
summaries: Jordan and South Korea have pledged to cooperate on regulatory issues.

text: Just after the Fourth of July holiday, and only a week after the city's budget has been completed, City Council Member Robert Jackson will hold two town hall meetings in cooperation with several other Northern Manhattan elected officials.
summaries: Robert Jackson will hold two town hall meetings.

text: Tim Cowlishaw made a bad joke and now the MMA blogosphere is lighting torches and sharpening pitchforks.
summaries: Tim Cowlishaw made a bad joke.

text: Prime Minister Gordon Brown said Monday he had discussed the car industry crisis with German Chancellor Angela Merkel, but had not talked about any specific amount of aid for General Motors.
summaries: Gordon Brown had discussed the car industry crisis with Angela Merkel.

text: Fun and food are two ways to help Children's Hospital of Illinois during the month of July.
summaries: Fun and food are two ways to help Children's Hospital.

text: Police have denied fears that emergency response times will increase due to a forthcoming restructure.
summaries: Police have denied fears response times will increase.

text: Little Rock - Governor Mike Beebe today announced his intent to grant six pardons.
summaries: Mike Beebe today announced his intent to grant six pardons.

text: Andrzej Fonfara defeated Glen Johnson with a unanimous decision victory, which was enough to convince Johnson that he should retire from the sport of boxing.
summaries: Andrzej Fonfara defeated Glen Johnson.

text: England manager Fabio Capello is refusing to get carried away with thoughts of qualifying for the 2010 World Cup finals despite watching his side record a fourth successive victory.
summaries: Fabio Capello is refusing to get carried away.

text: A former Gulf Breeze Police officer is being arrested this morning on sexual battery and unlawful compensation charges, according to Gulf Breeze Deputy Chief of Police Robert Randle.
summaries: A former Gulf Breeze Police officer is being arrested.

text: An Abilene teenager was killed early Sunday in a one-car wreck just east of Chapman.
summaries: An Abilene teenager was killed early Sunday in a wreck.

text: The screenings identify people at high risk for stroke, abdominal aortic aneurysm, peripheral vascular disease, and osteoporosis.
summaries: The screenings identify for stroke vascular disease, and osteoporosis.

text: West Indies spinner Sulieman Benn bowled a marathon, uninterrupted spell of 33 overs on the first day of the first Test against England on Wednesday to dispel many of the question marks over his ability.
summaries: Sulieman Benn bowled a marathon, spell.

text: A Dutch physiotherapist has claimed that he uses two miniature pigs to help his patients in Germany.
summaries: He uses two pigs to help his patients.

text: Strictly Come Dancing increased its lead over The X Factor in the Saturday night day ratings last night.
summaries: Strictly Come Dancing increased its lead over The X Factor in the ratings.

text: The Times Square bombing suspect pleaded guilty Monday to a terror plot hoping to maim and kill those in the international tourist destination and American landmark.
summaries: The Times Square bombing suspect pleaded guilty.

text: Boxer Lamont Peterson failed a drug test, putting a May 19 light-welterweight rematch in Las Vegas against former title holder Amir Khan in doubt, a Nevada boxing official said Tuesday.
summaries: Lamont Peterson failed a drug test.

text: Britain would be justified to withdraw the Royal wedding invitation that has been extended to a representative of Robert Mugabe√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s regime as the Evening Standard has revealed.
summaries: Britain would be justified to withdraw the Royal wedding invitation.

text: Intermec Inc., which makes electronic devices for tracking inventory, plans to cut 150 jobs, or 7 percent of its work force.
summaries: Intermec Inc. plans to cut 150 jobs, or 7 percent of its work force.

text: Narain Karthikeyan of Team India finished 10th in both sprint and features at the A1 Grand Prix motorsport race here Sunday.
summaries: Narain Karthikeyan finished 10th at the A1 Grand Prix race.

text: Today's celebrity pictures include a demure Rita Ora in a white halter-neck gown as she attends the Bergdorf Goodman 111th anniversary celebration in New York.
summaries: Today's celebrity pictures include.

text: South Africa must continue with the stimulus package it has adopted as a response to the financial crisis, Minister of Finance Pravin Gordhan said on Sunday.
summaries: South Africa must continue with the stimulus package.

text: State Representative Dan Gattis has proposed a law that would allow police officers to draw the blood of suspected drunk drivers without a warrant.
summaries: A law would allow police officers to draw the blood.
